Never mind.  Two seconds after I posted this, I realized that the
runtime w=
asn't finding the libraries because Maven wasn't magically
copying them int=
o the build.  I manually copied them into the build
and it worked.  

I hop=
e my frequent posting here hasn't become too annoying.

--- In archive-craw=
ler@yahoogroups.com, "Kaleb" <lostokies@...> wrote:
>
> Thanks for the cont=
inued help.  Building Perl projects is a lot
> different than this.  
> 
> =
I've managed to build Heritrix with the new jars in the project files
> and=
 I get no complaints from my java file about unknown imports.  But
> when I=
 run Heritrix and try to add the new deciderule to a module, I
> get a jsp =
exception page with this: 
> -----------
> An error occured
> 
> java.lang.=
NoClassDefFoundError:
> org/apache/xmlrpc/client/XmlRpcClientConfig
> -----=
------
> 
> XmlRpcClientConfig is a class defined in one of the jars I adde=
d to
> the project.  I have no idea why the project would find the jars
> d=
uring the compile, but the runtime have no idea where they are.  
> 
> I am=
 |-| close to having something working, but I've wasted the last 4
> hours =
in vain.  Perhaps you might also know how to resolve this problem?
> 
> Tha=
nks again,
> Kaleb 
> 
> 
> 
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Mich=
ael Stack <stack@> wrote:
> >
> > Kaleb wrote:
> > >
> > > First, thank you=
 so much for the response. That was a ton of help.
> > > Just one more ques=
tion. If I already have the jar files and want to
> > > use my local copies=
, can I just add their location to the
> > > project.properties, or do I al=
so need to add them to the
> project.xml file?
> > >
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> =
> You need to add in both places.  Make sure that the ID in the 
> > projec=
t.xml dependency section matches the ID suffix in your 
> > 'maven.jar.ID' =
entry in project.properties.
> > St.Ack
> > 
> > 
> > >
> > > --- In archiv=
e-crawler@yahoogroups.com 
> > > <mailto:archive-crawler%40yahoogroups.com>=
, Michael Stack <stack@> 
> > > wrote:
> > > >
> > > > See the dependencies=
 section in the project.xml. If the xmlrpc
> lib is
> > > > available up in=
 the maven1 ibiblio repository, maven should just
> fetch
> > > > it for yo=
u (You may need to add the following to your
> > > project.properties
> > >=
 > file because Heritrix is still stuck on maven 1.0.x:
> > > > maven.repo.=
remote=3Dhttp://repo1.maven.org/maven 
> > > <http://repo1.maven.org/maven>=
).
> > > >
> > > > Here is some more info on Heritrix and lib jars in case =
the above
> > > proves
> > > > insufficent. Heritrix goes out of its way to=
 defeat mavens
> dependency
> > > > fetching mechanism. It does this by set=
ting 'maven.jar.override
> =3D on'
> > > > in project.properties and then m=
apping project.xml dependency
> > > > references to actual locations under =
the lib directory (again in
> > > > project.properties). The thinking at th=
e time was that the
Heritrix
> > > > checkout contained all needed to run i=
n the likes of eclipse.
Maven
> > > was
> > > > not required (This will pro=
bably change when we move to m2).
> > > >
> > > > For example, for the libi=
dn jar, in project.xml, it looks like
this:
> > > >
> > > > ...
> > > > <de=
pendency>
> > > > <id>libidn</id>
> > > > <version>0.5.9</version>
> > > > =
<url>http://www.gnu.org/software/libidn/ 
> > > <http://www.gnu.org/softwar=
e/libidn/></url>
> > > > <properties>
> > > > <war.bundle>true</war.bundle>=

> > > > <ear.bundle>true</ear.bundle>
> > > > <ear.bundle.dir>APP-INF/lib<=
/ear.bundle.dir>
> > > > <description>GNU Libidn is an implementation of th=
e
> > > > Stringprep,
> > > > Punycode and IDNA specifications defined by t=
he IETF
> > > > Internationalized Domain Names (IDN) working group,
> > > u=
sed for
> > > > internationalized domain names.
> > > > </description>
> > =
> > <license>GNU Lesser General Public License
> > > > http://www.gnu.org/l=
icenses/lgpl.txt 
> > > <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl.txt></license>
> =
> > > </properties>
> > > > </dependency>
> > > > ...
> > > >
> > > > The '=
id' libidn from above is then mapped in project properties
> to the
> > > >=
 libidn-0.5.9.jar with the following project.properties line:
> > > >
> > >=
 > maven.jar.libidn =3D ${basedir}/lib/libidn-0.5.9.jar
> > > >
> > > > You=
 might also want to edit .classpath so your new jar shows in
> eclipse.
> >=
 > >
> > > > Hope this helps,
> > > > St.Ack
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > Kaleb =
wrote:
> > > > >
> > > > > I need to add the Apache XMLRPC jars to the Heri=
trix build,
> but I have
> > > > > no idea how to add these to Maven. Could=
 someone point me in the
> > > > > right direction or at some pertinent doc=
uments? I've had no
> problems
> > > > > adding these libs to Netbeans proj=
ects, but I don't
understand the
> > > > > Maven documentation and am floun=
dering.
> > > > >
> > > > > Thanks,
> > > > > Kaleb
> > > > >
> > > > >
> >=
 > >
